website_summaries.verdict: Pry-proof, and spacious for the price, it provides users all the benefits of a wall safe at an impressive price.
pros: A top-selling model that gives users security at a value price
It stands out for being easy to install yet nearly impossible for burglars to remove
We love that it comes with a 10-year warranty
cons: The keypad and knob are made of flimsy plastic, but all the crucial parts are heavy-duty
The locking mechanism protrudes, making the safe more difficult to conceal with a painting

customer_reviews.title: it will deter thieves AND THE OWNER
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid - seems to be 1/4" plate steel. It's heavy and I'm confident that should it be installed, it would deter thieves. Now, the bad - it will also deter the owner of the valuable contents! it's not functional. The rotating lock/unlock plastic knob simply broke off in my hand rendering the lock moot. The "multi-product all purpose" directions were clear in that a key needed to be inserted in the mechanism, but no lock exists that would allow the key to be inserted,...very weird. And I ordered it NEW and it was delivered clearly USED - very irritating. This would make a great boat anchor. I am rarely THIS disappointed with an amazon purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: It is a mixed review
customer_reviews.text: The tale of 2 safes. I read all the reviews and didn’t believe all the reviews saying the door wouldn’t open. Safe #1...I couldn’t get the door to open. I tried everything I could think of, including all the recommendations in the reviews, with no luck. Safe #2...the door opened easily. I installed the safe and it works as it should. Safe #1 was returned. I am a 70+ year old female. The weight was a problem so I installed brackets to hold up the safe while installing it. I was concerned that having it sit in the drywall while being screwed into the studs would crush the drywall. The safe is great and I installed it with no help!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn H. Mcadams

customer_reviews.title: Safe that won't unlock.  Customer service is awful.
customer_reviews.text: Have not installed yet. Cannot get the code to work consistently. Don't trust it enough to install. My user entered code worked a couple times after I turned the unlock wheel back and forth, now nothing after the green light. Plus, the paint/powder coating peeled off when I removed the masking tape. The worst part is they only have email customer service. They strive to answer the question(s) in one business day. It appears sturdy and it is heavy. Not much room since the locking mechanism is so large. More to come....
customer_reviews.author: Douglas T. Towns

customer_reviews.title: very hard to open / had to adjust bottom hinge
customer_reviews.text: This safe is very difficult to open once the code is put in. im not sure if it will loosen up over time or what, but as it is i have to pry it open with a flathead once it is unlocked. Im going to have to modify some kind of handle onto it so that i can get to it quickly when needed. updating my review. Had to adjust the bottom hinge set screw to increase the hight of the door.. To do this i backed out the retaining screw, in screwed in a set screw so the door would sit higher up on the bottom pin. The door now swings outward when unlocked.
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: The product does not have all the bells and whistles of the more expensive wall safes, but I did not need anything more than what was provided. Product was really easy to install. Agree with previous reviews regarding a cheep screw used to remove cover for key access. The door on my safe was not easy to open due to the door a little out of alignment. I added a cabinet pull knob to the front of my unit for easier open and closing of the hinged door. Regardless of the lower rating, I believe this safe will get me through the next 5-10 years before an upgrade is needed.
customer_reviews.author: DwayneJD

customer_reviews.title: Zero Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I've had to return this safe because it arrived with obvious defects. The foam packaging was not damaged but the front of the safe had an obvious paint defect and dent. The defect was beginning to show signs of rust. Along the top of the door you can also see more paint defects - they had to of packaged it this way! I'm going to spend the extra money this time and buy from a more reputable brand with better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Labiosa

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Very difficult to open
customer_reviews.text: I just had this safe installed so I cannot comment on long term use, but at this point it is very disappointing to me. There is no handle to open door with - just the nob, which is hard to hold since substantial force is needed to pull the door open. My prior wall safe had handle that easily unlocked the safe and was easy to pull. I wish I realized it sooner, before installing this one. Also during the install the safe color chipped off quite a bit, I am assuming since paint quality if poor. I do not recommend since it will be very difficult to open.
customer_reviews.author: zs

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Was easy to install. I first located the studs and cut a small hole from side-to-side to make sure there was nothing in the way. Then cut the hole the size of the back of the safe. Marked holes for bolts. Pre-drilled. And finished attaching it to the studs. Voila!
customer_reviews.author: Stephens215

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Size is exact on the button. If you frame your wall out, may be good to leave an extra 1/8 of an inch - just in case the framing has a slight bulge. Super Snug fit. Bolts are in, that thing is going no where. The only thing I really did not like is the locking mechanism takes up some of the middle shelf. so put something small there.
customer_reviews.author: Hans-Jurgen Greiner

customer_reviews.title: Paragon Wall lock and safe
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a 5 start rating but for a couple major issues. The instructions are a mess. When first opening the safe with the key and locking handle both must be turned at the same time for the door to open. Not in instructions, had to call customer service. Next the door sticks unless you adjust the door springs. Again nothing in instructions. Safe seems to be well built and is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Russell B. Temple

customer_reviews.title: Works, looks good, now for hiding it with a mirror or something
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this awhile ago and about 8 months later, got around to installing it. It looks good, works perfect. I did remove the speaker, because its has a very loud "beep" when you press the buttons - after removing the speaker - its much better and everybody in the neighborhood won't know when you are opening your safe. Not sure how I'm going to cover it; A picture would work, but mine is in a closet, having a picture in a closet seems kinda silly. Why would someone put a picture in a closet? I'm thinking mirror might be more convincing.
customer_reviews.author: Thedual5s

customer_reviews.title: Setting the code was easy. I cut the drywall between the studs and ...
customer_reviews.text: The product came as described. The corners of the door near the hinge is a little bent on both the top and bottom. Setting the code was easy. I cut the drywall between the studs and the installation process was smooth. My wife hung a cheap a picture over it to conceal the (the pictures seem the safe is not level, it is leveled properly). Space is limited behind the lock mechanism, so take that into consideration when buying this safe. I added a 2x4 on the bottom to support the safe's base. Should have taken pictures to give an idea. The safe definitely is not fireproof at all, so consider what you plan to place in it.
customer_reviews.author: DVD

customer_reviews.title: Good safe, but keypad not flush and buttons beep loudly
customer_reviews.text: Good safe, easy to install, but the keypad is NOT flush with the rest of the safe. It sticks out about half an inch from the face which was a real bummer for my application. If that is important to you this same company does make models where the keypad is flush. Also the keypad beeps loudly when each button is pressed. I’m going to call their customer service to see if I can silence that or remove the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Safe, Fit and Finish are Variable
customer_reviews.text: Had to return Safe #1 - door wouldn't open properly, it jammed against the frame. Safe # 2 had issues unlocking with the key. I called customer support and they explained how to correct this with the internal mechanism. It took a minute, very easy. The Door on this one is far from an airtight fit, but it works. This is a great value for the money. As far as installation goes, I located the studs with a finder, cut the hole with a sawzall. I didn't need any extra wood, it fit right between the walls studs, snugly. I recommend using a ratchet wrench with a socket to drive in the bolts, saves a lot of effort.
customer_reviews.author: KilgoreTrout

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about a year ago. Installs easily. Combination is easy to set. My only complaint is the access for the key. To use the key you have to unscrew a plastic plate to reveal the key lock. This is very poor design. I drilled a hole into the plastic plate to allow easy access for the key. A picture hangs over the wall safe so the combination and the key hole do not show. Great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Works great, door is adjustable too.
customer_reviews.text: You know I wouldn't store the crown jewels in this thing but for a few items and some handguns I think it will work quite well. It's not perfectly square nor is it incredibly beautiful, reading some reviews high I think people expected it to look like the Mona Lisa and be made of tungsten. If you have an allen wrench and a modicum of ability you can make adjustments to the door so that it closes better for your situation. It seems to work quite well so far!
customer_reviews.author: Disco Dude

customer_reviews.title: Keypad failed in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY happy with this when I ordered it. It is heavy as can be, I like that it comes with both a key as backup and works off a numeric pad. But I really wanted the ease of the numeric pad, not having to go get my key to get into it...but the keypad failed,after less than a month, after maybe 5 different uses. So while the construction of the safe itself is a five star, it gets knocked back to two for failing in its primary role as a keypad safe after just a month.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Where's the Key Hole
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a very good product. Unfortunately, the first shipment did not have the key hole. The replacement shipment was the same. Please see the picture. I am basing my assumption that I would need to put the key in this supposedly keyhole to open the same first. Perhaps I am wrong. Anyway, I returned this item on July 22, 2020 and waiting for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Tanghal

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, great value!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very glad I bought this, for the money it is an excellent value. A lot more substantial than I expected. Thick, heavy, solid! There are a couple negatives, the latch knob is a little 'plastic-y' and seems too lose but works fine. The locking mechanism mounted on the inside of the door protrudes into the middle of the safe. Those are the only two negatives. The heft, solid feel, tight door clearances more than make up for the negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I order this safe for my dad this Father's Day ...
customer_reviews.text: I order this safe for my dad this Father's Day 2017 and I had to return it since in order to open it for the first time you have to remove the front part with a screw driver and use the key to unlock it in order to insert the batteries. Well the screw was so low quality as soon as I turn the screw driver the screw messed up and I couldn't open it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deadbolts Door locks will not release door.
customer_reviews.text: Unit was bought for a construction project opened box today Feb3 to set up. Found key process would not open door, key codes matched with keys to locks but no matter how we tried door would not unlock to set up combination. Unit sat in box over 30 days now have to contact manufacturer to try to correct. Upon further trying found black knob on unit would not move deadbolts to unlock door. Managed to unlock unit twice , with numerous tries black knob will not always energize bolt jams bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Keep their hands out of your pockets!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. I bought this to keep my credit cards and 9mm locked up. More about keeping my wife from taking my credit cards and going on damn shopping sprees while I am sleeping. She always seems to find the credit cards where ever I hide them. Now she knows where they are and cannot get to them. This wall safe has already saved me hundreds of dollars since her shopping has decreased exponentially. I recommend this safe to anyone who is trying to save money but has a wife or girlfriend that doesn't know when to stop spending.
customer_reviews.author: Lou T

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty.  Great Value.  Small Interior.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding product for the price. I also disabled the electronic beeps for stealth. The push buttons do feel cheap and it isn't hard to imagine that if you used them everyday it wouldnt take very long to wear them out. But it also comes with 2 keys. I'd buy this again and recommend it to anyone needing a small safe that fits into a normal residential wall without having to cut any studs.
customer_reviews.author: vette67

customer_reviews.title: Great wall safe for the money
customer_reviews.text: Second time purchasing this as we left the first one in our last house. Great deal for the price. It is pretty straight forward to install - just make sure you know where your wall studs are. You will need support on either side to screw into. I feel confident enough that someone can't easily get this out of the wall without really putting in time and effort. Only issue I had with this one was the paint was chipping off in a number of areas - most likely due to shipping. Not bad enough to bother returning.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: works but limited space
customer_reviews.text: these work great, I have one at my shop and one in my house- easy to program, has a manual key over ride and has worked perfectly every time! the middle shelf is very limited since the lock mechanism is large and takes up most of the space. good for cash, a small gun or coins but not a lot of anything!
customer_reviews.author: Dave F.

customer_reviews.title: Wall safe
customer_reviews.text: Took about an hour with cutting and other adjustments. It's not cavernous, but clearly conseals well and secures a few trinkets or cash well. I serious don't ever expect this to be broken into. Ever. Heavy construction. Worth the small price. Comes with override keys.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Mclarnon

customer_reviews.title: Insecure, easily defeated, and unreliable to boot
customer_reviews.text: Caution - this item is ultra insecure, can be opened with just a hammer and good timing!!! Look on Youtube for piece of cake insructions. So I had this wall safe tucked away out of sight, and one day the opening mechansm seized, could not be turned. Not only did the POS fail, but it was trivial to defeat. Would give Zero stars if possible, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Arjay

customer_reviews.title: Great hidden wall safe
customer_reviews.text: Second one, great closet safe. strong and secure, easy to install. Be aware it is heavy and you my need another person to install. The safe is heavy enough that it pretty much destroys the packaging. I had one corner of the safe slightly damaged but not enough to worry bout it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy safe that is cheaply made and designed
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy safe that seems well build especially for the price. However, the locking mechanism is below average! The key mechanical lock can’t be accessed without removing the plastic cheaply made and designed front electronic locking mechanism and in the process the plate with the numbers simply fall off like some cheaply made and designed product. One can put these toghther but isn’t very user friendly. Returned this within an honor receiving it...thanks to great Amazon customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Get safe measurements so contractor can set studs for safe in wall correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Nice safe. Not sure the safe I got was not a returned model. I had to repair connection between combination wheel and closures bolts because they were disconnected. Took about 15 minutes but was not difficult. Hard to find a vendor on eBay with safe in stock. Overall, I am pleased with safe and how it functions. Easy to set personal combination and it looks very nice after installation.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C

customer_reviews.title: This does the job
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and set up in 30 mins. or so. This safe wont stop pro's, but for normal security from prying eyes it is totally adequate. Some paint chips on corners out of the box, but otherwise good quality for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D.

customer_reviews.title: Just a few issues.
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well built but there is room for improvement. The front is not flat, the knob you turn to pull the locking bolts back sticks out. If you stick a picture in front you either need a deep picture frame or let the picture be away from the wall. It only opens to the right. Seems to me since the push buttons for the lock are electronic they could be set up so you could flip the safe so it opens to the left. A template for cutting the drywall hole would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Rapid City

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad deal for the right level of use see details for more
customer_reviews.text: It's not some amazing product but it gets the job done as a panic room style closet that has everything my wife needs to barricade up, call 911 and defend herself and home office if there is a robber or home invasion. Heavy construction and fit perfectly between studs. Bolts are cheap and easy to sheer so be careful. Don't store the hope diamond in this thing. It will keep kids and others out but not made for serious security. Best inside a closet and not flush enough to fit behind a picture. Rather shallow inside but can hold a couple of handguns, magazines, light and spare 911 cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: REVONDA KAY JONES

customer_reviews.title: The shelves have no lip on them, so objects can fall out.
customer_reviews.text: The way the shelves are designed ,there is no lip to prevent objects from sliding off. if you turn the shelf over there is a lip but the door won't open because of no notch now on the door hinge side. . So, I cut a notch and it works great and nothing slides off the shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman Machgan

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad at all for the price
customer_reviews.text: Like that it was a little more of a heavier steel then I had expected, kind of the cheapish Plastic panel on the front which worse of all sticks out little and not as flush to the door. For the price however it was a great but and achieves what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Jones

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping for a better safe. Do not waste you money on this ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a better safe. Do not waste you money on this One its footprint is big and the space inside is very small. The safe is about 3.75 inches deep. The major issue is that the locking mechanism takes up a lot of space. THE ENTIRE MIDDLE SECTION TAKE UP 1/3 OF THE ROOM. The locks are cheap plastic. About the only good thing about this is the sturdy metal box.
customer_reviews.author: AaronSr

customer_reviews.title: Okay for basic safe - minus delivery product defects
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Solid steel frame Easy installation The Bad: It appears the keypad and unlock mechanism is pretty cheap. Works, but it appears it could break within a year The installation instructions leave something to be desired. Installing the product in the wall was easy, setting/changing the keycode took some trial and error. To use the key you must unscrew one screw on the keypad. Mine was stripped out upon shipment, so I had to drill it out. The key is required when it is delivered to set the keycode. If I didn't have the product defect at arrival I would give it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C

customer_reviews.title: Screw for faceplate has NO THREAD
customer_reviews.text: I would like to just get the screw for the faceplate, but I can't seem to find out how. It's either replace the entire unit or head to Home Depot and try to find another. The screw that came with it has no thread and the faceplate just falls off. And of course the screw is an odd size. Seems like a waste of money to replace the entire unit. Not off to a good start. I will see if anyone responds to my question. If we can fix this problem, I'll be happy to update my poor review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Had a little trouble setting up the first code but after that all good. It's got a ten year warrantee so as long as the company stays in business you're covered. I know from working with electronic equipment if it makes the first 90 days you're usually good. This safe it self will just slow down anyone from trying to get in it, as it is with most home safes. I've seen posts that said you could get to same safe from Harbor Freight for less money but theirs only has a 90 day warrantee.
customer_reviews.author: blueman

customer_reviews.title: not as good as 7700
customer_reviews.text: lock is not as strong as 7700 but certainly good for the money. instructions on door adjustment should be included for not-so-handy installers but I figured it out. would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: fljhawk

customer_reviews.title: Well priced safe
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is an excellent safe. Yes you do lose most of the middle shelf to the keypad/locking mechanism. So lets say it is a sturdy and secure 2 shelf wall safe for approx $80. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, very sturdy and secure.
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation. I'm a 42 year old woman, I knocked this out in about an hour. Cut the hole, Mark drill holes, drill, and then screw in bolts. That safe will go no where! It's size is fine for my needs. I have two guns in it, and all of my critical documents, and still have ample room. Beeping on keypad is in necessary but whatever. Also the keypad isn't lit so you'd have to turn a light on at night.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Safe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great safe, provides for a very clean install. We installed in a closed behind a door. Perfect place to store guns, jewelry, money ect with quick access and spring loaded door.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Safety Box...
customer_reviews.text: I really love this convince Safety Box. Easy to mount, only took 30 minutes of mi time. Perfect for keep my Pistol and ammo away. Also for cash, passports and jewelry..
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Luna

customer_reviews.title: Nice safe for the price, but bolts will snap if you tighten too much
customer_reviews.text: Be careful of the bolts they provide. Very cheap and snap off easily when tightening. Also no instructions on how to install, though very easy but some instructions would be nice. Also dont like the requirement to have a screw driver to remove cover to access the key. Should be simple snap.
customer_reviews.author: Royalboater

customer_reviews.title: The door catches on the bottom.  Check before installing.
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a replacement safe when I learned, after installation, that the door was catching on the bottom and difficult to close and in particular to open. I tried filing off the bottom of the door, which helped but did not solve the problem. I ordered a replacement which arrived today and has the same defect. So, I am returning the replacement and going back to work filing more off the bottom of the door. Installation went well and the safe is otherwise just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: janet m.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. The spot welds that attach the box and door/flange assembly broke during installation and it ended up in two pieces. The door/flange assembly can be easily pryed off the safe box exposing everything inside. I received a one piece "safe" and returned two pieces. Don't waste your money and buy a real safe that actually protects valuables.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P.

customer_reviews.title: Its ok, if you need a cheap wall safe.
customer_reviews.text: It's not built fantastic and a majority of the middle shelf is used up with the opening mechanism and keypad leaving very little use able space. The door has two lugs on one side only and it sits almost .75" outside the wall if you flush mount it. I recessed it behind the drywall edge and it still sticks out from the finished edge a quarter inch.
customer_reviews.author: G. Olson

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy with my Safe
customer_reviews.text: Love this safe has served it’s purpose for keeping my prescriptions safe and out of the reach of unnecessary hands. I’m very pleased with my safe, and the product was very well made. Not a very easy install, I’d say it required someone who knew more then I (my handy husband to make the correct size hole made inside my wall) but very discreet once installed !
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Great safe for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great safe for the money. It won't keep a determined thief out, but won't let a quick break in get in easily. The center section is much smaller then the other 2 due to the lock stinking into the center. The alternative would be it would stick out into the room, so it's a trade off. I have 2 of these.
customer_reviews.author: Tazman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice safe for the money.  Installs easily if the space between studs is normal spacing of 16".
customer_reviews.text: This safe was easy to install and it's great for my wife's necklaces and earrings. The only problem is the door doesn't fit tight; there is a small opening along the latch edge that could be used for a pry bar. I glued a thin metal shim on the inside edge near the latch to make the door fit tight.
customer_reviews.author: Gary EP

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good enough as far as security.
customer_reviews.text: Had to edit this review because shortly after it was installed the safe stopped locking.. the lock went bad. When I opened the locking mechanism I was surprised how similar it looked to a fisher-price safe I had when I was 8. all I can do now is return it and well its in the wall.. Cheap but good enough as far as security. after all you could rip it out the wall with a sawzall. i knocked it down a few stars because the locking mechanism requires me to punch the safe to get it to lock. also its not flush with the wall but it doesn't say it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Who likes this safe??? This guy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt my first impression was that it was heavier than I expected. Looks to be well made, solid feel. Definitely happy for what I had invested in it. Not much space but a good safe for some important papers, a pistol, or maybe some jewelry. Why not 5 stars you ask? Well either my studs are not exactly to dimension or this is too wide. I had to remove a bit of the stud to get it into the cavity. Also it would be great if there was a mute button to make access silent in the event you must retrieve contents in stealth mode.
customer_reviews.author: RIckyPMTZ

customer_reviews.title: I was somewhat disappointed with the lack of storage there was in this ...
customer_reviews.text: Since this is my 2nd wall safe, I was somewhat disappointed with the lack of storage there was in this wall safe. The bulkiness of the lock in the center of the safe limits the use of the middle shelf inside - which was disappointing. (I didn't notice this until the safe was installed in the wall - which is too late to return).... I would research other wall safes in the future and not install it until I tried putting stuff inside - and shutting the door first.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen L.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: This perfect for my purposes. It fit easily between the studs in my wall. Simply instillation. Very please with quality. One suggestion do not use the enclosed batteries. Spend a few pennies more and get good quality batteries.
customer_reviews.author: B J

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have documents secure at home
customer_reviews.text: Installing was easy if you have the guts to use a dry wall knife and make a mess, but hey you want an in wall safe right? Instructions are a little lacking but it's easy to figure out. We wanted to have documents secured beyond just in a drawer with a flimsy desk key lock. This will deter most opportunistic thieves that are in an out, and I'm sure even most cause they would have to come in with lots of tools, make lots of noise and spend lots of time trying to get it out of the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jef

customer_reviews.title: Feeling Secure
customer_reviews.text: Really love this safe. Perfect size for a home users, it is very solid and just large enough to fit all my very important documents in a fire proof bag plus many key pieces of jewelry. Exceptionally easy to install and it will never come out without tearing down the wall. Very easy to program too, plus you always have a key if needed.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Druce

customer_reviews.title: Better than leaving stacks of cash under the mattress
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to install and hide in a closet or false wall or whatever. It is not very deep but I was able to fit a dozen bricks of cash and several gold bars inside. It didn’t leave a ton of room for any Star Wars action figures but overall I’m really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: Me like
customer_reviews.text: It mounts inbetween the studs in your walls(16" on center) so make sure the wall you want to place it on is framed correctly. Meaning it isnt a closet on the other side of the wall or anything. Also dont plan o being able to mount tthis dead center of your wall unless it was framed that way or you are willing. It can be hidden dehind a picture but it needs to be something like a canvas painting that has a little room behind it. I perfer to have mine uncovered in my office just so if someone were to look in the window they would know my valuables are probably in the safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to install and fit right between the studs. I’m a 74 yr old woman and did it by myself. I love the way it locks and opens. Feels very secure. Big enough. Easy to hide.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lisi

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Good value. Metal is thicker than I expected. Like other safes of this type I expect that the electronics can be overcome by a knowledge burglar, but for basic security this is hard to beat. Should be really hard to open with hand tools.
customer_reviews.author: jweaks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and security
customer_reviews.text: This is a really heavy duty safe. Well made and fits perfectly between 16 inch o/c studs. Highly recommend for safekeeping of valuables.
customer_reviews.author: ob1

customer_reviews.title: Right price and keeps valuables secure
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the three versions available for the price listed, I chose this one. It installed easy enough and the code was easy to program. The shelves inside are a cheap metal and didn't fit exactly like they should, but for the money, it works. Overall, someone would have a little time vested in trying to pry this beast open. I say easy to install, but that is if you are comfortable with cutting a hold in your sheetrock, fitting between the studs and mounting. If this scares you, then self install is probably not the best.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it’s used
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived NOT in the original manufacturers box it looked like it was a return and was just thrown in a box and mailed out box arrived damaged when I place an order I expect the item to be new in the original manufactures box!
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Tate

customer_reviews.title: This safe seems to be sturdy, I have only had it installed for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This safe seems to be sturdy, I have only had it installed for a month. I did notice that there were a few locations where the welds were not complete (tiny gaps), non of which are visible from the outside of the safe. I have the safe concealed behind a canvas picture, and you would not even know it is there. When flush mounted the nob sits about half an inch off of the wall, so consider that before purchasing .
customer_reviews.author: Tim Harris

customer_reviews.title: Feels substantial
customer_reviews.text: This safe feels very substantial, heavier gauge steel than I was expecting. The install went mostly smoothly, as long as your wall studs are the correct width. The locking mechanism is as expected, fine for my purpose. I did take the liberty of applying adhesive fire proof sheeting on the entire back, sides and top. After one house fire, I believe it will buy me at least a short time of protection for the contents.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lackey

customer_reviews.title: Great. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this and installed in our closet. He was able to mount it flush to the wall in a corner and the door opens with no problem so it fits great in a tight space. You don’t even notice it’s there.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2boys

customer_reviews.title: Great safe
customer_reviews.text: The safe arrived on time and well packed. There were no dings or scratches and all the parts needed to install were there. I installed it in a closet behind some clothes and the neutral color blends in well. Even if a burglar found the safe, it would take a fair amount of time to break into the wall and cut the attached studs out and I don't think the average non-professional could break into the safe. There's plenty of room for a pistol, some jewelry, gold coins, cash, passports and other important papers. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: futurescape

customer_reviews.title: The key doesn't even work!
customer_reviews.text: I regret ordering this. I had read another review that said the key didn't fit...but I ignored it. Turned out they were right. They key fits but only turns slightly less than a quarter turn. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas P Child

customer_reviews.title: Great value, mounted between two studs it kept my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this safe in my garage and use it to store car keys because my garage door gets left open more than it should. The house was broken into a few weeks ago and they tried to pry open this safe but could not, the key pad was damaged but the safe stayed secure and we could access it using the over ride key (do not store those in the safe). Great value, mounted between two studs it kept my keys safe.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Bach

customer_reviews.title: Good value safe for small items.
customer_reviews.text: If I could turn down the volume of the buttons, it would be 5 Stars. I was able to cut the whole between the studs and mount the safe in 30 minutes. It is narrow inside but it holds everything well. We don't keep much in it but it reduces the chance of someone stealing our $300 laptop and bar code scanner in our meeting room.
customer_reviews.author: mcgman

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just installed it. Easy to install between 14in studs in my home. Between 16in you would have to fill the gap. Fit like a glove. Don't use the batteries they send you. Use betters ones like duracells. Great for the money, it does the trick. Packaging was not that great but not damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Rigid Safe
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably easy to install. Mine came with no template and looked like it had been a return. Worked it out and after cutting the hole in the sheetrock I had to pad it out because the studs were wider than the safe. Quite heavy as it is good sturdy steel all round. Used for important papers, wife's jewelry, passports, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: The screws are cheap the steal ends will round off if you use a drill or driver. I used the safe for a few days and started to have problems with the knob spinning and not opening the safe, the mide shelf is useless
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I feel very comfortable having this item
customer_reviews.text: There are 3 shelves yet only 2 are usable. When the door is closed, The locking mechanisms Extend into the one shelf. I guess I might try to hand necklaces in the back of that shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa G.

customer_reviews.title: Limited inside space
customer_reviews.text: Safe was a perfect fit between the wall studs, however, the locking systems takes up the entire center inside area of the safe leaving only the top and bottom areas for storage. Not sure I would purchase this product again due to lack of space.
customer_reviews.author: W. Grace

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a very similar safe - we actually like this one better - opens easy - easy to change the combination. We have it mounted in wall between two studs with a lot of bolts - would not be easy to get out unless they cut the whole wall out.
customer_reviews.author: HV Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great price - great value
customer_reviews.text: Great price and great value I've bought a few of these types of safes and this one is an excellent price. Construction is a B-. Fabrication of the door shows inconsistencies. Interior mechanism was missing a battery door and could not source it. Not critical. But Amazon Customer Service were their usual GREAT selves... Lock and unlock mechanism seems to be without any issues. I would definately buy again as the price is great and it serves the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: J Ro***

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install if you have a little handyman skills. Fits perfectly between two studs. Put in the closet in the master bedroom for important stuff. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, does the job well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install; just make sure you open wall up first before cutting into studs to avoid cutting any wiring. Hint: if there is an outlet or light switch directly above or below the safe it's likely there will be wires along the studs.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Pacelli, Author

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: The install was pretty easy for this safe. My upstairs has larger spacing and I had to add some 2x4s to build out the studs, but even with that the entire install took under 45 minutes. One issue that I share with other reviewers is the fact that you have to find a screwdriver to open up the panel that houses the keypad to get to the actual physical location to use the key to manually open the safe. Just hope I'm never in an emergency situation where the batteries are dead.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zerr

customer_reviews.title: I would have passed on this item if i knew it was gonna be like that.
customer_reviews.text: Just got done installing this safe. Not very impressed. Two of the screws that hold the keypad housing to the door fell out. The round actuator on the front that opens the door is un-nervingly wiggly. I would have passed on this item if i knew it was gonna be like that. The shelves are very flimsy too.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built, loose parts, do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: You definitely get what you pay for. This safe is poorly built. When the door is shut and the bolts are engaged, the door moves around 1/4 inch. You can easily pry this open. There is no way to adjust this. Also, when it arrived, all of the screws were extremely loose. One had fallen out of the shelf. I returned the unit and only got back $44.17. You'll be responsible for the shipping cost when you return this piece of garbage. Save yourself the time and expense by selecting a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Roger M. Hansen Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty wall safe for the money with thick metal wall construction ! The welds could have been cleaner, in addition the the black lock set assembly is not straight / perpendicular to the cabinet. This cheapens the appearance of the wall safe, and it's angled / crocked appearance is very noticeable to the eye.
customer_reviews.author: MPS

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works and installs as advertised. Still haven't figured out how to program and store 2 entry codes. Check battery life often. When they’re low, you need the key to gain access (this would be inconvenient in an emergency situation).
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT

customer_reviews.title: The lock sticks and I could hear loosely chiming metal ...
customer_reviews.text: The lock sticks and I could hear loosely chiming metal when I turned the key. The only way I could get it open was via a rubber mallet on the side. Needless to say it is going back. After further review, I might go a different route as I imagined if this happened AFTER I have it bolted to the wall I have to demo to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn S

customer_reviews.title: Great valuables/pistol safe
customer_reviews.text: Love it, have it next to my bed. Got a few documents 2 pistols with magazines, gopro, jewelry, and watches stored in it. I go into it every week, and have only replaced the battery once in 3 & 1/2 years. Make sure to keep the manual though.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Tam

customer_reviews.title: Great safe, secure, and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This safe was very easy to install, easy to use, and feel it would take some doing to break into it. Extremely satisfied with this safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I just installed my third one of these. They are simple and straightforward, seem to last, and do what they advertise. Storage capacity is only limited b/c of the stud depth.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Lock handle feels cheap but everything else feels good. Button sound is very loud which in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Lock handle feels cheap but everything else feels good. Button sound is very loud which in my opinion is not good for a gun safe. You cannot access the key without removing the front plate which is difficult.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not good or great
customer_reviews.text: Cheap manufacturing quality and very poor final inspection. All interior shelves were not tightened. Screws, washers and nuts were float around the inside. Paint was missing and some rust.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A sim

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: I needed a unobtrusive, easily installed, well built, secure container to store small valuable items and documents. This safe works perfectly for my needs and I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Keven

customer_reviews.title: nice, but....
customer_reviews.text: I do like it but a couple of challanges. as seen in other posts, the "beep" for the key pad is way to loud. tried to muffel it but did not work so well. the thing is that there seems to be about 1/8 gap from the locking bars to the frame which seem to allow the door to bang back and forth when wntering the code. still working on that challange. I was easy to install and works great for my needs at home.
customer_reviews.author: MWMiller

customer_reviews.title: Safe is not what description says it is.  Not happy with product
customer_reviews.text: Safe is not what I was buying, The actual storage spae is very small, the Door make up uses most of storage space. If I had discovered this prior to installation I would have return for a refund. Not happy with product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Young

customer_reviews.title: Better built than expected
customer_reviews.text: Good sized, well made, works as pretty much as described. Combination setting instructions somewhat unclear, but managable. Not sure of how secure this unit really is since key hole gives access to determined or knowledgeable thief. One word of caution: unit requires a "full 14 1/4+ inches" between studs, which can be difficult in older properties, or with inaccurately placed studs. Still I consider it a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Chan

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and installed it as a surprise gift for his bday and he loves it. It Arrived fast, easy to install, small enough to put a picture over. feels heavy duty except the knob itself feels super flimsy and cheap. Other then that, great buy.
customer_reviews.author: BShopper

customer_reviews.title: WELL BUILT - EASY TO INSTALL
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. A very well built, substantial wall safe. Easy to install, easy to use. Middle shelf holds a lot, in spite of comments to the contrary (you just have to pick and choose what fits there best). Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: It does not work, could not open. The key did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Red Herring

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Welding was compromised and the door was out of line. Thank you to Amazon for a quick credit.
customer_reviews.author: bkwrm

customer_reviews.title: Nice safe especially the price.
customer_reviews.text: Safe is excellent, easy to install (kind of) but you really need to make sure it's aligned between studs. First safe delivered was slightly damaged but was an easy exchange. Amazon was a little slow on dealing with this issue. But got it all squared away. Only downside of the safe is you can't mute the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Devil Dawg

product_meta.title: 7750 Electronic Wall Safe Hidden Large Safes Jewelry Secure-Paragon Lock & Safe
product_meta.description:
If you are considering an electronic wall safe, look no further. We are pleased to Introduce the Quarter Master 7750 Digital Keypad Deluxe Home Office Security Wall Safe by the Paragon Lock and Safe Co. It is perfect for the home, office, or vacation home. It was designed with the intent to secure your valuables in a concealed location - behind a picture or inside a closet. The Quarter Master 7750 offers 2 options to open, code or key. We include a 10 Year Manufacturer Warranty. The best part of this item is the price, it is significantly less than similarly featured safes and is packed with more features! 

Features: 

 * Digital entry eliminates the need for making multiple key copies. 
 * Flat Panel Design so you can conceal the safe. 
 * Easy to operate and program. 
 * Larger and More Robust than the competition. 
 * Store your jewelry and valuables! 
 * Opens with secret PIN code or included keys (2 FREE KEYS). 
 * Simple programmable Electronic Lock with buzzer and LED. 3 to 8 numbers. 
 * Code can be changed infinitely. 
 * Fits between the studs. Easy to install yourself. 
 * Runs on AA SIZE(1.5V) batteries (Included). 
 * Constructed with solid steel to resist hand and mechanical tool attacks. 
 * Pre-drilled holes inside the safe with fixing bolts allowing anchoring. 
 * Powder coated interior and exterior. 
 * Safe door opens to the right. 
 * Constructed of 1/8" thick solid steel. 
 * Inside tamper-proof hinges. 
 * Grey carpet mat padding on inside bottom. 
 * Anchor bolts are included. 
 * Outside dimensions: 22" high x 16 1/4" wide x 4" deep. 
 * Inside wall dimensions: 20.25" high x 14.25" wide x 3.75" deep. 
 * Weighs approximately 39 pounds. 
 * 1" Frame around the front of Safe conceals lines that are not cut straight along drywall. 
 * Simple to install. 
 * Color: Off White. 

COMPARE TO THE COMPETITION--THESE ARE HEAVIER, MORE ROBUST, AND LARGER!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
